title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 October 2014 - XWiki
content:
has quit 02:35  has quit 03:05  has joined #xwiki 03:08  has quit 03:50  has joined #xwiki 04:03  has quit 04:24  has joined #xwiki 07:00  has joined #xwiki 07:24  has joined #xwiki 07:49  has quit 08:19  has joined #xwiki 08:21  has joined #xwiki 08:36  has joined #xwiki 08:53  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 09:09  has joined #xwiki 09:12  has joined #xwiki 09:14  has joined #xwiki 09:41  has joined #xwiki 09:54  has joined #xwiki 09:54  has quit 09:54  has joined #xwiki 09:58  has joined #xwiki 10:08  has joined #xwiki 10:10  Guys, I had a stack trace when I started the SNAPSHOT this morning: http://hastebin.com/wofaquzoge.avrasm 10:15  actually it is even worse: http://hastebin.com/yamucitiki.m 10:15  the last step of the initialization in the browser 10:15  has joined #xwiki 10:16  has joined #xwiki 10:16  ouch 10:17  looks like the changes from thomas/marius on the sdoc stuff no? 10:20  java.lang.AbstractMethodError 10:20  sound like build order issue 10:20  or you have two jars not in sync on your side 10:22  yes, I remember seeing that one as well yesterday when trying 6.3 snapshot 10:23  that or mflorea forgot to commit one thing since it seems related to his last commit 10:23  but I doubt that since I guess platform would not build 10:23  checking jenkins 10:24  there is failing tests to look at but you can't have an issue like java.lang.AbstractMethodError without failing to actually build 10:27  the failing tests are ui tests, so they are not related 10:27  and from the screenshots XWiki has started 10:27  I did not looked at the details but anyway this kind of issue would not go as far as tests 10:28  so it really sounds like two jar not in sync in gdelhumeau side for some reason 10:28  s/in/on/ 10:31  hmm I've seen this failure another time recently: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-6.2.x/104/console 10:32  it looks like some corrupted zip 10:32  rebuildig 10:44  has joined #xwiki 10:52  ok, I restart using -U with maven 10:56  same problem, crap 10:56  has quit 10:59  Please do not commit on the 5.4.x branch 10:59  I release as soon as the build is ended 11:16  has joined #xwiki 11:32  has quit 11:45  has left #xwiki 11:55  has joined #xwiki 12:18  Hi, i'm occasionally getting #retrieveSetting('showcomments' $settingValue) #retrieveSetting('showattachments' $settingValue) #retrieveSetting('showhistory' $settingValue) #retrieveSetting('showinformation' $settingValue) #retrieveSetting('showannotations' $settingValue)   string on top/bottom of the page... any ideas, what could cause it? 12:21  has quit 12:38  has joined #xwiki 12:56  has joined #xwiki 12:58  has quit 13:12  funny name we chose for "displayUnexpectedException" since, by definition, an exception is expected :) 13:13  and even more, it's not something that is used automatically by an userlying service, but the developer needs to explicitly calling, making it more awkward :) 13:20  Enygma`: what I wanted to express was a way to display exceptions that have not been handled/manager and that bubble up to the top 13:21  let me check the code 13:21  in macros.vm I guess 13:21  DarkKnightCZ: was it in the Flamingo Theme Editor? 13:21  looks ok to me 13:21  the message displayed is "Unexpected error" 13:21  this means some error that we couldn't handle 13:22  hence the unexpected part 13:22  has quit 13:22  thus our only option in the end is to display it 13:22  and ask the user to contact the admin 13:22  last resort 13:26  displayUnhandledException maybe? 13:26  anyway, not making a big deal about it, just thought it was a funny name 13:27  Unexpected is longer than Unhandled so it's more Enterprise 13:30  cjd is too short a name, you should change it! 13:31  but Caleb James DeLisle is perfect 13:31  very enterprisy! 13:31  13:31 [freenode] -!- Nick cj is already in use 13:31  you should thank your parents 13:31  :) 13:31  heh 13:33  Enygma`: now is the right time to change it if you feel strongly about it… woul dbe too late after 13:33  getLastErr() :D 13:33  displayUnhandledException is fine with me too 13:34  using fewer letters saves BinaryTrees 13:39  has joined #xwiki 13:42  has joined #xwiki 13:42  vmassol: yes, I`ve just noticed in the release notes and it kind of poked my eye :) 13:44  changing it if nobody complains 13:44  was introduced in 6.3M1 right? 13:46  yes 13:56  ok so good, right time to change it 14:02  has quit 14:02  has joined #xwiki 14:02  done 14:03  updating RN 14:04  has quit 14:09  has joined #xwiki 14:11  vmassol: I think it`s safe to close http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11025 since the work done by ClemensR fixes the problem described by the issue (spaces in app name). I`m proposing to close this for 6.1M1 and create 2 new issues for the remaining 2 problems: 14:11  1) creating an app with special chars in name (my^app example by msmeria) and 14:11  yes, I am about adding followups 14:12  and then close the XWIKI-11025 (after renamaing so it is clear it only handles spaces) 14:12  1) is XWIKI-11237 14:13  sounds good 14:13  +1 just make sure to link the issues pls to easily find more details on the subject 14:18  links added 14:22  gdelhumeau: not really, in normal pages... but i have slightly modified flamingo theme, so i'm not sure if i didn't make it (but the file with those definitions should be intact) 14:22  commits done for 5.4.6 14:22  going to lunch before doing the rest 14:22  tmortagne: agent1-1 is all yours 14:23  gdelhumeau: thanks, finishing to write a test and looks like we'll need to stabilize jenkins... 16:05  has joined #xwiki 16:08  has quit 16:09  has quit 16:10  guys the cause for the failing test on platform are that when you click save&continue when editing user preference tab you end up on wiki home page 16:10  has joined #xwiki 16:10  more precisely you end up on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/Main/?category=preferences 16:10  tmortagne: wow big bug 16:10  only present on master I hope 16:10  sounds like "" missuse of reference resolver 16:10  yes only on master 16:11  but those test were not failing yesterday... 16:11  actually I don't really know if it's only on master 16:11  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/3e45475edb3f81af96210cc3e1e42985ce6e76c7 ? 16:11  did not looked at other versions 16:12  gdelhumeau: yes possibly, checking on my local instance 16:13  hmm no doesn't reproduce 16:13  and I should have my changes 16:13  going to rebuild now 16:14  it does not sounds like a behavior caused by this commit 16:16  has quit 16:18  the redirect is caused by 16:18  which is generated somewhere in the user sheet in edit mode 16:18  has joined #xwiki 16:21  the link is generated in javascript using XWiki.currentDocument.getURL('view', 'category=' + category) 16:21  has quit 16:21  has quit 16:31  has joined #xwiki 16:33  vmassol: it started failing after XWIKI-11229 but I don't see how it could be related 16:35  yes there's no relationship 16:35  Maybe it comes from the meta I have removed 16:36  wasn't this today ? 16:36  yesterday eveing 16:36  the tests are failing since yesterday evening so maybe 16:36  but I don't see your commit before  it's failing 16:38  hmm jenkins seems to be missing some commits actually 16:38  the time on github for your commits make it a possible cause AFAICS 16:40  has joined #xwiki 16:42  has quit 16:42  is now known as 16:49  yes, it should be that 16:49  damn 16:50  compatibility.js is started after xwiki.js 16:50  and now, xwiki.js needs it 16:50  or a new api to get the page metza 17:02  gdelhumeau: isn't compatibility.js supposed to contain deprecated stuff ? 17:02  yes, so I am not fixing it 17:12  sorry for that -\_- 17:15  has quit 17:24  just reported this weird behavior in rendering http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-368 (noticed by evalica) 17:26  Enygma`: include macro is in platform 17:27  blah, I had the feeling I was not in the right place, but just wanted to have that reported quickly... 17:27  but since I was not 100% sure of the cause I`ve reported it in rendering... 17:29  I`ll let someone who knows what he is doing to move it if necesary 17:30  it's possible it's more generic than include macro anyway 17:30  has quit 17:31  Enygma`: by the way two macro in the same paragraph are supposed to ending up in same paragraph and here looks like you want to standalone results so putting them next to each other is wrong anyway 17:32  s/to standalone/two standalone/ 17:36  tmortagne: that is a workaround to get rid of the crappy
generated between the include macro and the velocity macro 17:36  that`s why they are on the same line 17:37  the same behavior happens if they are on diferent lines 17:37  you are not supposed to get a
between two standalone contents 17:37  just that the first bogus paragraph contains a br 17:37  did you really had empty line between them ? 17:37  two paragraphs are separated by an empty line 17:37  two consecutive lines does not make two different paragrahs 17:38  tmortagne:  this http://hastebin.com/tomofehufo.django generates this http://hastebin.com/aripikudog.xml 17:38  http://hastebin.com/tomofehufo.django is not two standalone macros 17:38  so no diference if include and velocity are on the same line or not 17:38  you need an empty line for that 17:39  getting a
is actually the only thing right about  http://hastebin.com/aripikudog.xml 17:39  what is not right is getting several

17:40  wow... that new line between include and velocity made the paragraphs go away... because that was intuitive! (not!) 17:40  but thanks anyway. I will add a comment to that issue 17:41  now, why would it be intuitive to add an empty line (which generally translates into getting a new paragraph in wiki syntax) between those macros? 17:41  thats because you have a weird definition of a paragraph, when you have http://hastebin.com/tutufuroso.hs is a single paragraph on a book that's one prargraph not two 17:41  s/prargraph/paragraph/ 17:42  the fact that it's macro does not matter 17:42  it's the same for any content 17:42  so if I have "a" on one line, then an empty space and then "b" on the 3rd line, is that 2 paragraphs? 17:43  yeah, that`s silly http://hastebin.com/ojixakojav.xml 17:44  I mean, it`s not silly 17:44  the macro behavior is silly because it does not respect this 17:44  replace "a" with an "include" and "b" with a "velocity" and the above principle is not respected 17:45  Enygma`: as I told you the fact that you end up with several

is a bug 17:45  and a recent one AFAIK 17:45  when you really separate the macros it behave as expected 17:46  tmortagne: it behaves as expected, but it is still wrong, right? 17:46  what is wrong ? 17:46  I don't understand what you means 17:46  is this correct http://hastebin.com/ojixakojav.xml ? 17:47  http://hastebin.com/ojixakojav.xml is what I explained to you, you get two paragraphs because you do have two paragraphs 17:47  so it is correct 17:48  yes it is correct, when did I told you it wasn't ? 17:52  tmortagne: ok, I got it now :) 17:52  so in any case, the empty paragraphs before and after are a bug 17:53  the multiple

are wrong yes, there should be only one (with a div inside because you kind of "force" it in the velocity macro) 17:54  thanks tmortagne 17:54  that's why I did not closed the jira issue 18:00  I have to go, guys please try to not commit dangerous things on master and I will release 6.3M1 as soon as I open my computer tomorrow morning 18:01  has quit 18:01  has quit 18:03  ah, no dangerous ... too late, I am afraid ;) 18:08  has quit 18:21  we're still loosing by 1 bug for thie week (and we lost by 2 last week): http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa#Created-vs-Resolved-Chart/10470 ;) 18:23  has joined #xwiki 18:25  maybe I should not open two bugs that I notice while fixing one bug ;) 18:27  hehe 18:30  has quit 18:53  has joined #xwiki 18:54  is now known as 19:04  has quit 19:19  has quit 19:22  has quit 19:38  has quit 19:55  has quit 20:00  has quit 20:01  has quit 20:01  has joined #xwiki 20:02  has quit 20:12  has quit 20:31  has joined #xwiki 20:38  has quit 20:39  has joined #xwiki 20:47  has joined #xwiki 20:55  has quit 21:03  has joined #xwiki 21:03  has joined #xwiki 21:39  has joined #xwiki 21:43  has quit 21:56  has quit 21:57  has joined #xwiki 22:24  has quit 22:34  has joined #xwiki 23:41  has quit
